title: Show the data

steps.hint: Now we are going to put the data to use. We’ll print it out in a way anyone can read it. Start off by getting the weather with `weather = get 'weather', location`
We're going write some of the data we just got onto the screen of our app. Let’s set the font first with `font 30`.
The text should also be easy to read, so we’ll make it bold with `bold true`

Next, we’ll write the text. Part of the text will always say the same thing, but part of it should *vary* depending on the location, so we’ll use text, combined with a variable. **Type** `text 'Wind speed in ' + location`
Now lets draw the wind speed, it should appear just below the current text. Lets move into position with `move 0, 120`
The speed should be big, so we’ll set it with `font 100`
Again, what we want to appear will change depending on the wind, so we’ll use text from the data. **Type** `text weather.wind.speed + 'mph'`

completion_text: Amazing! Change the location to see wind speeds around the world.
